sensitivityConverter.meta_title: Roblox Rivals Sensitivity Converter - Precision Aim Settings Calculator | RivalsCodes
sensitivityConverter.meta_description: Free Rivals True-Aim Calibrator sensitivity converter to accurately convert aim settings between Valorant, CS:GO, CS2, Apex Legends, and Roblox Rivals. Calculate cm/360, eDPI, and recommended settings to improve your gameplay.
sensitivityConverter.meta_keywords: Roblox Rivals sensitivity converter, Rivals aim settings calculator, Valorant to Rivals sensitivity, CS:GO to Rivals sens, Rivals sensitivity multiplier, cm/360 calculator, eDPI calculator, Rivals aim settings, How to match Rivals sens with Roblox, Rivals sensitivity multiplier explained
sensitivityConverter.pageDescription: Accurately convert sensitivity settings between Valorant, CS:GO, CS2, Apex Legends, and Roblox Rivals while maintaining the same cm/360 value for consistent aim feel.
sensitivityConverter.conversionDirectionDesc: Choose whether to convert from other games to Rivals or from Rivals to other games
sensitivityConverter.sourceGameSettingsDesc: Enter your sensitivity settings from other games
sensitivityConverter.targetGameSettingsDesc: Select the target game to convert to
sensitivityConverter.rivalsSettingsDesc: Roblox base sensitivity and Rivals in-game multiplier
sensitivityConverter.robloxSensitivityHint: Base sensitivity value in Roblox settings (typically range 0-10)
sensitivityConverter.dpiShared: Uses the same DPI setting as source game
sensitivityConverter.cmPer360Desc: How many centimeters of mouse movement to rotate 360 degrees
sensitivityConverter.recommendedTargetSensitivityDesc: Recommended sensitivity value to use in {game}
sensitivityConverter.multiplierEffectDesc: Roblox base sensitivity and Rivals multiplier are multiplicative. For example: 0.2 Roblox Sens × 2.0 Rivals Multiplier = 0.4 Roblox Sens × 1.0 Rivals Multiplier, both have the same effect.
sensitivityConverter.seoSection1Content: Rivals True-Aim Calibrator is a professional sensitivity conversion tool that helps players maintain consistent aim feel across different FPS games. By calculating cm/360 (mouse movement distance) and eDPI (effective DPI), you can easily convert sensitivity settings from Valorant, CS:GO, CS2, or Apex Legends to Roblox Rivals, and vice versa.
sensitivityConverter.seoSection2Title: How to Use Rivals Sensitivity Converter?
sensitivityConverter.seoSection2Content: Using this tool is very simple: 1) Choose conversion direction (to Rivals or from Rivals); 2) Enter source game sensitivity value and mouse DPI; 3) View recommended Roblox base sensitivity and Rivals multiplier; 4) Apply recommended settings or manually adjust for optimal feel. The tool calculates cm/360 and eDPI in real-time to help you find the best settings.
sensitivityConverter.seoSection3Content: Different games use different sensitivity systems, and directly copying values will result in completely different aim feel. By maintaining the same cm/360 value, you ensure the same mouse movement distance for the same view rotation across different games, preserving muscle memory and aim consistency. This is especially important for competitive players.
sensitivityConverter.faq1Question: How do I find my Roblox base sensitivity?
sensitivityConverter.faq1Answer: Roblox base sensitivity can be found in the Roblox settings menu. This is the global sensitivity setting that affects all Roblox games. The Rivals in-game multiplier slider multiplies on top of this base value.
sensitivityConverter.faq2Answer: cm/360 means how many centimeters of mouse movement are needed to rotate the in-game view 360 degrees. This is a standardized measurement unit used to compare sensitivity settings across different games. Lower cm/360 values indicate higher sensitivity (less mouse movement for more rotation).
sensitivityConverter.faq3Question: How does the Rivals multiplier slider work?
sensitivityConverter.faq3Answer: The Rivals multiplier slider multiplies with the Roblox base sensitivity. For example, if your Roblox sensitivity is 0.2 and Rivals multiplier is 2.0, the effective sensitivity is equivalent to 0.4. You can adjust both values to find the combination that works best for you.

metaLab.meta_title: Rivals Meta Lab - Weapon Stats & TTK Calculator | RivalsCodes
metaLab.meta_description: Rivals Meta Lab provides comprehensive weapon statistics, TTK calculator, DPS analysis, and weapon tier list. Learn detailed stats for each weapon including damage, fire rate, movement speed, and more to optimize your gameplay strategy.
metaLab.meta_keywords: Rivals weapon stats, Rivals TTK calculator, Rivals DPS calculator, Rivals tier list, Rivals weapon comparison, Rivals meta analysis, weapon damage stats, Rivals best weapons
metaLab.pageDescription: Comprehensive weapon data analysis tool with detailed statistics, TTK calculator, and weapon tier list to help you understand current weapon strength in the meta.
metaLab.ttkCalculatorDesc: Calculate time to kill under different conditions
metaLab.tierListDesc: Comprehensive ranking based on DPS, TTK, and movement speed
metaLab.seoSection1Content: Rivals Meta Lab is a professional weapon data analysis platform that provides detailed weapon statistics, TTK (Time to Kill) calculator, and weapon strength rankings for players. By analyzing key data such as damage, fire rate, DPS, movement speed penalties for each weapon, it helps players understand current weapon strength in the meta and make optimal weapon choices.
metaLab.seoSection2Title: How to Use the TTK Calculator?
metaLab.seoSection2Content: The TTK calculator helps you calculate the time required to eliminate a target under different conditions. Simply select a weapon, enter target health, choose whether armor is present, and whether to calculate headshot-only damage. The tool automatically calculates required shots and time to kill. This is very useful for comparing weapon performance across different scenarios.
metaLab.seoSection3Title: How is the Weapon Tier List Calculated?
metaLab.seoSection3Content: The weapon tier list is based on a comprehensive scoring system that considers DPS (damage per second), TTK (time to kill), and movement speed modifiers. S-tier weapons typically have the highest DPS and lowest TTK, suitable for competitive play; A-tier weapons are excellent but slightly lacking; B and C-tier weapons are suitable for specific scenarios or casual play.
metaLab.faq1Question: How often is the data updated?
metaLab.faq1Answer: Weapon data is regularly maintained based on game version updates. When the game receives balance adjustments, we update relevant data as soon as possible to ensure accuracy and timeliness of information.
metaLab.faq2Question: Does the TTK calculator consider damage falloff?
metaLab.faq2Answer: The current version of the TTK calculator uses base damage values for calculations. If a weapon has damage falloff, actual TTK may vary by distance. We recommend testing at close and long range separately for more accurate results.
metaLab.faq3Question: How to understand movement speed penalties?
metaLab.faq3Answer: Movement speed penalty indicates the percentage reduction in movement speed when using that weapon. Negative values indicate reduced movement speed (e.g., -10% means 10% slower), positive values indicate increased movement speed (e.g., +5% means 5% faster). This is very important for tactics requiring quick movement.

marketIndex.meta_title: Rivals Market Index - Virtual Asset Valuation & Trading Assistant | RivalsCodes
marketIndex.meta_description: Rivals Market Index provides real-time asset value search, inventory calculator, price trend tracking, and trading assistant. Check current market values for wraps, charms, finishers, calculate your account total value, and track price trends.
marketIndex.meta_keywords: Rivals asset value, Rivals inventory calculator, Rivals price tracker, Rivals trading, Rivals wrap value, Rivals charm value, Rivals finisher value, Rivals market index, Rivals value list
marketIndex.pageDescription: Real-time asset value search, inventory calculator, price trend tracking, and trading assistance.
marketIndex.valueSearchDesc: Search item name to view current market value
marketIndex.inventoryCalculatorDesc: Select items you own to automatically calculate total account value
marketIndex.priceTrendsDesc: View historical price changes for items
marketIndex.tradingAssistantDesc: Compare trade values and calculate profit/loss
marketIndex.scamWarningDesc: Always verify trader identity, use official trading channels, and avoid scams when trading.
marketIndex.seoSection1Content: Rivals Market Index is a professional virtual asset valuation and trading assistance platform. It integrates data from major trading Discord channels and community value lists to provide players with accurate asset value references. Through real-time value search, inventory calculator, and price trend tracking, it helps players understand market conditions and make informed trading decisions.
marketIndex.seoSection2Title: How to Use the Inventory Calculator?
marketIndex.seoSection2Content: The inventory calculator helps you quickly calculate your account's total value. Simply check the items you own in the item list, and the system will automatically calculate the total value (displayed in Keys, Robux, and USD). You can also filter by type (Wraps, Charms, Finishers) or use the search function to quickly find specific items. The calculation results can be used to showcase account value or evaluate trade offers.
marketIndex.seoSection3Content: The price trend feature shows historical changes in item values. By viewing price history, you can understand the rise and fall trends of item values and determine whether it's suitable to buy or sell. Price increases may indicate increased demand or decreased supply, while price decreases may indicate market saturation or decreased demand. Combined with trade frequency data, you can better assess item liquidity.
marketIndex.faq1Answer: Our data comes from multiple reliable sources, including major trading Discord channels, community opinion leaders' value lists (such as Mud's), and trading data regularly scraped by AI crawlers. We use weighted average algorithms to calculate reference values, ensuring data accuracy and timeliness.
marketIndex.faq2Answer: Asset price data is updated hourly. We monitor Discord channels and community spreadsheets through automated processes, scrape the latest trading data, and calculate weighted average prices. Major price changes will be reflected immediately after data updates.
marketIndex.faq3Answer: We strongly recommend using official trading channels, verifying trader identity, and avoiding private trades. Use our trading assistant to compare item values from both sides before trading to ensure fairness. If you discover suspicious trades or scams, please report immediately.
